smuggle.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to take something or someone illegally from one country to another
smuggle.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The guns were smuggled across the border.
Illegal immigrants are smuggled into the country by boat.
smuggle.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to take something or someone secretly to a place where they are not allowed to be
smuggle.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: He smuggled his notes into the exam.
smuggle.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to take something or someone illegally from one country to another
smuggle.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: They caught her trying to smuggle drugs into France.
The silver was found in Yugoslavia and smuggled out.
